Title: TelescopeScripting
Description: Meant to be used as an interface with RTGUI+S for easy scripting and telescope control
HomeWiki:
Project Description
This project is mean to be used in conjunction with RTGUI+S and Cartes du Ciel (Skycharts) for easy scripting and observing.


Features

  • Scripts - consist of RTGUI+S commands.  These commands control RTGUI and Cartes du Ciel as well as telescopes or other programs that accept command line arguments. Per RTGUI+S limitations, you can only have up to 25 commands per script.
  • Script saving and loading.  Once you create and name a script, you can save it to your computer.  You can then retrieve later and load it up.
  • Script modifications - It is made easy to add, insert, remove commands from a script.  In addition, you can reorder commands in a script by moving them up or down.  If you have a command selected, you can also modify it and save the changes.
  • Play Lists - these are groups of scripts that can be run, one after the other. You can add, remove or reorder playlists in a similar fashion to Scripts.
  • Catalogs - RTGUI comes with a couple of catalogs, as well as others that you can add. However, sometimes you want a more refined catalog to work with.  You can now create "sub-catalogs" from other catalogs.  
  • You can add, remove, and reorder items in these sub-catalogs you create.  Once you have saved a "sub-catalog" you can create scripts and play lists based on the catalog.
  • You can refine catalogs you are searching through using regular expressions
